a measurement of the number of moles of substance in 1000 grams of solvent: Molality can be expressed as the number of moles of solute in one kilogram of solvent. The composition of a solution can be expressed in various ways including molality. See
molal
More examplesFewer examplesIn this equation mB is the molality of the solute. The common or practical unit of concentration is the molality.Molality is the reference concentration for most thermodynamic data.
